thread.title: Ashley Graham flaunts her curves in new swimwear collection after Vogue's 'photoshopping' cover shoot row
thread.title_full: Ashley Graham flaunts her curves in new swimwear collection after Vogue's 'photoshopping' cover shoot row

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Ashley Graham flaunts her curves in new swimwear collection after Vogue's 'photoshopping' cover shoot row
text:
Ashley Graham flaunts her curves after Vogue's 'diversity' cover shoot controversy The 'plus-size' model has put her figure ion display to launch her new swimsuits collection Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Ashley Graham has defiantly put her figure on show in a sexy swimsuit photoshoot after controversy over Vogue magazine's recent 'diversity' cover . 
The body positivity advocate - who regularly posts inspiring messages on social media encouraging everyone to love their bodies regardless of shape or size - has launched her new collection for Swimsuits for All. 
The Sports Illustrated swimsuit issue is celebrating and championing 'regular women' - and Ashley even appears alongside non-professional models in a unique new campaign. Ashley Graham has launched the new Swimsuits For All campaign (Photo: Publicity Picture) She posed with non-professional models for the set (Photo: Publicity Picture) The star continues to break down boundaries (Photo: Publicity Picture) She stuns in the gorgeous shoot (Photo: Publicity Picture) 
Shot in Puerto Rico, the photoshoot includes local women from San Juan wearing the new designs. 
It comes as the America's Next Top Model judge has continued to push boundaries in the fashion industry. Locals from San Juan were used for the pictures (Photo: Publicity Picture) Ashley promotes body confidence (Photo: Publicity Picture) She has unveiled the new designs (Photo: Publicity Picture) She seeks to inspire all women (Photo: Publicity Picture) 
As well as gracing covers of the likes of Maxim and Cosmopolitan, she has also strutted her stuff on the runway for some major designers. 
As well as the Swimsuits For All campaign, she's also launched her own lingerie range for Addition Elle, and designed items for Dressbar. She recently hit out at critics of her Vogue cover (Photo: Publicity Picture) She's put her figure on display for this defiant shoot (Photo: Publicity Picture) The size 16 model wants to promote ordinary women (Photo: Publicity Picture) She returned for the unique campaign (Photo: Publicity Picture) 
It comes after Ashley hit back over criticism aimed at her first ever US Vogue magazine cover, with some sceptics making accusations of photoshopping and more. 
The star's pose in the snap sees her as the only model with her hand resting on her leg, with one critic writing: "Find this quite galling. Why is Ashley Graham the only one covering her thigh? Women Rule! 125 Years of Vogue (Photo: Inez and Vinoodh/Vogue) 
Many accuse the publication of editing the image to make Ashley – who is a size 16 – appear slimmer - with some fans pointing out that Gigi’s hand and arm looks “too long” as if it had been edited to cover up Ashley. 
Other noted it could have been Ashley's own arm around herself, while she cleared up the pose in a comment on Instagram. 
"I chose to pose like that," she clarified. "No one told me to do anything." Like us on Facebook
